column4: Quanta is complaining that ~/.kde/share/config/cvsservicerc is not writable. The permissions of the file are Owner: root, Access: Read and write. Group: root, Access: None. Others, Access: None. How should I change the permissions so that quanta can write to it?
welcome. maybe you ran Quanta as root or such.
No I didnt run it as root but it is a kde application and I am running gnome so I guess something wasnt setup properly when I installed it
judging from what you said, it probably doesn't need to be executable, though it probably doesn't matter. if that bugs you, ''chmod -x thefile''
There are a bunch of other files with locked permissions in that directory. Should I change them all?
this should cause no harm. i doubt that those files should be owned by anyone other than your user.
I just did sudo chown myuser:myuser path/*
well, that doesn't descend into subdirectories, btw.
And its fixed the problem. Thanks
